title: We asked these lawmakers to pose with their favorite junk food
text:
Six members of Congress dish about their favorite junk food.



Sen. Mike Lee (R-Utah) holds some Aggie's ice cream. “Eating Aggie ice cream takes me back to Utah. It is home sweet home in delicious frozen form.”



Sen. Mazie Hirono (D-Hawaii) enjoys a bowl of mochi crunch.



Rep. Lucy McBath (D-Ga.) eats popcorn. “Popcorn is just so quick and easy — it’s a snack for every occasion!”



Rep. Dan Crenshaw (R-Tex.) adds toppings to his Blue Bell Ice Cream.



Rep. Carol Miller (R-W.Va.) holds her signature homemade candied pecans. “I enjoy making my homemade pecans because they are healthy, fun to make and bring everyone together to snack on.”



Rep. Frederica S. Wilson (D-Fla.) with her favorite junk food. “French fries are golden, warm and crunchy and are never disappointing. I have always loved them; it was love at first bite!”

Credits:

Photos: Anisha Sisodia

Photo editor: Dudley Brooks

Photo/tech assistant: Paris Preston

Makeup/groomer: Shauné Hayes

Producer: Daniele Seiss

Production assistant: Monique Woo
